title: Squirrel on a wire part - a

content.description: A squirrel starts at building A at time t=0 and travels along a straight,horizontal wire connected to building B. For 0≤t≤18 , the squirrel's velocity is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.
content.question: At what times in the interval 0<t<18, if any, does the squirrel change direction? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: At what times in the interval 0<t<18, if any, does the squirrel change direction? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
